solution_line_template: With two substitutions, {starters}+{first_half_subs} = <<{starters}+{first_half_subs}={first_half_players}>>{first_half_players} players from the team played the game in the first half.

In the second half, the team made twice the number of substitutions it made in the first half, a total of {first_half_subs}*2 = <<{first_half_subs}*2={second_half_subs}>>{second_half_subs} substitutions.
The total number of players who played the game is {first_half_players}+{second_half_subs} = <<{first_half_players}+{second_half_subs}={total_players_played}>>{total_players_played}

If the soccer team had {total_team} players prepared for the soccer game, the number of players who did not play the game is {total_team}-{total_players_played} = <<{total_team}-{total_players_played}={did_not_play}>>{did_not_play} players.
